chapter.title: Introduction

formalpara.title: QDepo
formalpara.para: A desktop application for retrieving and exporting data from relational database systems to spreadsheet files, also formerly known as "TPDA - Query Repository Tool"

chapter.para: The supported formats are Excel .xls, ODF and CSV. The Database management system support includes CUBRID (new), Firebird, MySQL, PostgreSQL and SQLite.
The graphical user interface is based on wxPerl or PerlTk.

The main feature of the application is the SQL query repository management. The repository consists from a collection of XML files that ca easily be moved or copied to other computers. The XML data files have a .qdf extension. The queries can be parametrized and edited from the application user interface.
Export formats supported, and the required Perl modules:

listitem.para:
ODF
Open Document Format. - OpenOffice::OODoc or ODF::lpOD

formalpara.title: History
formalpara.para: The idea for this project, was born around 2002, from the necessity to run, monthly, the same queries against two small databases, with a couple of parameters changed at every run, and get the data in spreadsheet format for further processing. The first version was a single, big PerlTk script.
